name: "DBC Research Runbook: Submit to Research Ops for review"
about: To guide the submission of the study to the Platform's Research Ops for review and approval. 
labels: "disability-benenfits,research" 
assignees: ''

---

### Description
This ticket covers submitting the [study name] study to the Platform’s Research Ops for review and approval. The study focuses on [brief description of study]. 

Before kicking off participant recruiting, the Platform team's Research Ops must review and approve research materials, including:
- Research plan
- Conversation guide
- Testing prototype(s)

You should aim to complete the research review at least 10 days before research begins. The review process typically takes a few days to complete.

#### Timeframe for this ticket
This ticket should take well under a single sprint.

#### Output
[Add link to the research ticket when it's ready]

### Tasks
**Create a research ticket**
- [ ] To add your study to the [VA.gov Research Repository](https://github.com/orgs/department-of-veterans-affairs/projects/880), create a new ticket using [this ticket template](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-research-repository/issues/new?template=research-intake-form.yaml).
   - [ ] Note that the email Perigean sends to participants will likely have a subject line mirroring the title of your research ticket; so think about the wording of the ticket title.
   - [ ] Leave the Recruitment Criteria field blank; we’re not using research criteria issue cards.
   - [ ] Make yourself the assignee
   - [ ] Add labels for the project's product, research methodology, audience, etc. from this list. (See instructions about adding labels.)

**Submit your research ticket for review**
- [ ] In the #research-ops channel, send a slack message with a link to the research ticket to [Shane Strassberg](https://dsva.slack.com/team/U01RMUH860G) (or [Kevin Hoffman](https://dsva.slack.com/team/UHZ9VNBH8) if Shane is unavailable). Shane will go to your research folder and review the research plan and conversation guide. He'll leave any feedback in comments on the research ticket.
- [ ] Incorporate the feedback as needed.
- [ ] Move the ticket to the Current column in the [Research Repo](https://github.com/orgs/department-of-veterans-affairs/projects/880). Shane will add it to the Perigean project tracker, then send out a kick-off email with instructions for conducting research.
- [ ] Look for the kick-off email on how to proceed with recruiting.

### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Research materials have been approved by Research Ops
